question.text: If alien DNA is introduced using Pst I in pBR322 then transformant will grow on:

options.text: Both  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text: Tet<sup>R</sup> gene in pBR322 can be cleaved by Bam I and Sal I, while Amp<sup>R</sup> gene in pBR322 is cleaved by Pst I and Pvu I. If foreign DNA segment is inserted in Pst I site than ampicillin-resistant gene becomes inactive due to insertional inactivation and transformant can be grown on tetracycline containing medium.
